question: If ethane-1,2-diamine (en) is added to <katex>$[Ni(H_{2}O)_{6}]^{2+}$</katex>, complexes I (<katex>$[Ni(H_{2}O)_{4}en]^{2+}$</katex>) and III (<katex>$[Ni(en)_{3}]^{2+}$</katex>) are formed. The wavelength of light absorbed in I and III are respectively:
explanation: The ligand strength of 'en' is greater than <katex>$H_2O$</katex>. Complex III has a larger crystal field splitting than Complex I, so it absorbs higher energy (shorter wavelength). <katex>$\lambda_{I} > \lambda_{III}$</katex>.
